message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical exam findings suggest DiGeorge Syndrome, which is caused by a deletion in Chromosome 22. The heart murmur and the diminished shadow in the mediastinum are also common features of this syndrome. The other options are not associated with DiGeorge Syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of carpopedal spasm, heart murmur, and a diminished shadow in the mediastinum suggest DiGeorge Syndrome, which is caused by a deletion of chromosome 22. None of the other options are associated with DiGeorge Syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The combination of muscle stiffness, carpopedal spasm, heart murmur, and a diminished shadow in the mediastinum suggest DiGeorge syndrome, also known as 22q11.2 deletion syndrome, which is caused by a deletion of chromosome 22. None of the other answer choices are associated with DiGeorge syndrome.

We refer to the National Organization for Rare Disorders (NORD) for help. The presentation of muscle stiffness and a heart murmur, along with decreased mediastinal shadow on X-ray, suggest DiGeorge syndrome, which is caused by a chromosome 22q11.2 deletion. Therefore, option (C) is the correct answer.
